alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Noble; Oklahoma; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 9:51AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Oklahoma, northern Lincoln, southeastern Noble, southeastern Logan and Payne Counties through 1015 AM CST... At 950 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of moderate rainfall and a few isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles south of Pawnee to Stillwater to near Edmond. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Oklahoma City, Edmond, Stillwater, Cushing, Chandler, Perkins, Jones, Stroud, Langston, Yale, Luther, Davenport, Wellston, Morrison, Carney, Glencoe, Tryon, Ripley, Agra, and Coyle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 136 and 141. Interstate 44 between mile markers 136 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
